intro: Anemia gardneriana, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It is characterized by its star-shaped, white or pink flowers that bloom in winter. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and thrives in warm, humid climates. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance. Botanically, it belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is known for its compact growth habit.
